poem:
Title: "In the Ring of the Absurd"

A scuffle 'neath the lights-manufactured,
Jarring thunder of fists and virtual cheers.
A young pretender dancing with age's Titan,
The spectacle belies our vanishing years.
Digital gladiators in the web's shifting sand,
Where truth's line is carved by the mindless wave.
We watch, in our self-made prison band,
Drawn to the spectacle like moths to the brave.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Angry about Jake Paul v Mike Tyson? That’s the whole point of ‘influencer boxing’ | Tom Usher When I saw that the YouTuber turned celebrity boxer Jake Paul is going to fight Mike Tyson on 20 July, broadcast live on Netflix, my first thought was: is this a joke? But I quickly realised that, like much of contemporary life, it was too stupid to be a joke, and so must be real. My second thought". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Angry about Jake Paul v Mike Tyson?
